name: DoubleTree by Hilton Manchester Piccadilly

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: When booking my flight from Athens to Toronto, I had to make a connection in Manchester and had the option of giving myself 24 hours in Manchester so I thought "why not?". I booked this hotel because of the reviews on here and the location.
reviews.title: An Excellent Stay...but

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: I arrived in Manchester at 12:00 noon and British Airways had lost my luggage. This quickly put me into a terrible mood. I gave British Airways the hotel's address and contact info and was told my luggage would get to me ASAP. I got to the hotel in a foul mood. I checked in early, made it up to my room and my mood was changed. The room was beautiful. It was clean. It had a nice bottle of water waiting for me, if had an excellent view of the city, I could go on and on.
reviews.title: Great location in Manchester

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: There were only two negatives. The first one is not really the hotels fault, but rather the annoying guests of the hotel. There seemed to be a group of tourists from the USA (I know they were from the USA due to their constant chanting "U-S-A U-S-A") that decided that yelling in the hallway every few hours is an appropriate thing to do. Lucky for me, they always seemed to yell in front of my room, so I heard every word.
reviews.title: Good business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The second was my luggage situation. When I checked into the hotel, I told the lady that my luggage was delayed and will be delivered to me. She said okay and that was that. British Airways called me and told me that the luggage was going to be delivered within a few hours, so I went down again the told another lady that was working that I would be having my luggage delivered. She was friendly and said it would be fine. I decided to go out for dinner in the meantime and when I returned, I asked one of the employees if anything had been delivered. He said he didn't know, then disappeared for 10 minutes and said nothing has arrived. I found it strange, but figured it was just late for whatever reason. When I went upstairs I went online to track my luggage and it said "Delivery Unsuccessful". Odd. I called the airline's bagage line but it was past their hours of operation so I wasn't able to get through. I was a little annoyed but nothing I could do. The next morning, I called early in the morning and spoke to the driver that attempted to deliver my luggage. He said the hotel employee would not accept it. I didn't believe him as I had told 2 different employees my luggage was coming and all seemed fine. I asked him if he remembered who he spoke to and he didn't get a name, but he was able to describe one of the employees VERY well. It was the employee that I had asked if my luggage came in the previous night.
reviews.title: Highs and Lows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: I was very happy with the hotel up until this point, so it goes to show how one little thing can ruin a whole experience..
reviews.title: Cheeky bleeders !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is ideally located if you are travelling by train, being only a 3 minute walk from Picadilly station.We went to a concert at the MEN, which was only a 15 minute walk through the town centre. The staff at the hotel were exceptionally friendly and professional. The front desk staff were detailed in descriptions of hotel services and also helpful with directions. The only minus would have been the food. We ordered room service after returning from the concert. I ordered Falafel in a pittia bread but unfortunatley the sauce had either split or was off and in the morning I ordered eggs benedict, the sauce was bitter and unpleasant but that aside I would definatley stay at this hotel again and recommend the hotel to others.
reviews.title: Perfect location and friendly welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an excellent city hotel very close to Picadilly Station - we asked fo a quiet room on arrival and were allocated one on the front which suprisingly is the quieter side - the back has the trams going by. but I don't think that would be too bad! We are mid 50s travellers and I cannot agree with an earlier reviewer about its suitability for us! It is contemporary - rooms are great with excellent showers. The staff are very friendly and welcoming. The location is great very close to the station as mentioned and all the transport links around the city so it made it very easy for getting around. Breakfast is very good a buffet selection with cooked to order hot items. Not usual for a 4 star city hotel - nice change from he kept warm buffet.
reviews.title: Location Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The tradeoffs - well there are always some aren't there - the double bed was a little small and hard for us two tall travellers, and this silly iMAC that I am writing this review on works perfectly when you can get it going but has a remote control with a mind of its own! Great technology though when it is working. I am highly PC literate by the way so it is not Mac phobia! This is a great hotel however for £84 a night B&B at the weekend , you won't go wrong here and I can see why it is top rated in Manchster - it is fantastic value.
reviews.title: fantasctic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: just spent a saturday night for my boyfriends 30th and the hotel was excellent!! i am a travel aganet, and i emailed the hotel the week before to say we were celebrating a birthday and they upgraded us free of charge to a club room! and left a little card wishing happy birthday, nice touch!! we also got a 3pm check out which was excellent with a sunday hangover!! clean, spacious and loved the toilitries and robes!!
reviews.title: Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Excellent staff, excellent service, breakfast excellent (although I would recommend you make an effort to get up early - we did and it was nice and quiet and there was a queue outside when we left).
reviews.title: Attractive hotel, in a great city!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Just returned from a 2 night break and have to say overall, the experience was great. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Accommodation very clean and modern. Imac in room a bonus with free internet access.
reviews.title: Always good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast very good .... cinnamon toast with wild berries mmmmmm (and the berries actually tasted like berries should!)
reviews.title: the cocktails are to blame and I am a glutton for punishment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, near Picadilly station, bus station, shops etc.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Only negatives are on arrival, my rooms were not booked correctly. I had specifically booked an interconnecting room 1 x dbl and 1 x twin and when I checked in I was told I had 2 separate rooms across the corridor from one another. After a while, an interconnecting room was made available to us both dbl rooms. Also, matresses could be more comfortable i.m.o.
reviews.title: Perfect, again

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from this, everything else great in the hotel
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Price, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed here as my top two choices in Manchester were full. I have stayed at many Doubletree properties in the US but none in Europe. Upon checking in I was impressed by the lobby area, the hotel had quite a buzz about it being 11pm and the check in was quick and the staff were very good. I asked if room service was still open and was told no, but the staff member offered me two of the signature cookies instead of the usual one. Not the healthiest option, but it was yummy! After leaving reception, the first thing I noticed were the VERY slow elevators. It felt like ages until it finally arrived and this was repeated each time I used the lift. I had requested one of the Hilton e-upgrades to a higher category King Deluxe room and was told I had been given the upgrade. Upon reaching my room I realised that while the room was bigger, in a corner, and seemed to be "upgraded" the bed was not a king. Given the late hour I decided to leave it and just turn in. Although the room was a deluxe, it still seemed very small. I would hate to see the size of the smaller rooms. They must be like closets. The room also had an iMac in place of a TV. While at first glance this is a great, even cool, idea, it's not very functional. The screen was a bit small even for this small room, and the Apple TV style remote enables you to turn the TV off but does not allow you to turn the TV on in the morning, as I fouind out when forced to get out of bed to turn on BBC Breakfast. I found the bed to be extremely hard. Not like the beds you get at most Hilton propoerties including the lower category Hampton Inn. This was very disappointing. I wanted to check my email before bed and while this hotel boasts "free wifi" it was very slow and my room has almost no connectivity. One major thing that so many hotels get wrong is access to power ports. This room had plenty so I was able to charge all my devices during the night. My end of the hall room proved to be very quiet which despite the hard bed did allow me to get a decent, but not great, night's sleep. As it was quite warm that evening, the aircon was on and it was also very good and extremely quiet. Although I was in a deluxe room, the bathroom was also quite small. It also only had a small shower, but at least it had good water pressure. The one slightly anoying thing was the door that closes on it's own with no option to keep it open. I prefer to listen to the news in the morning while getting ready and this was not an option in this room.it was also evident that this room had seen better days. It was pretty well worn. Breakfast was included in the room rate, and it was average although the breakfast area was very loud, so I wouldn't plan on meeting clients or colleagues here. Upon checkout the staff were again efficient and friendly. When I commented on the upgrade charge and the lack of a King Bed, the staff member immediately credited it back without question. These people have been trained in customer service, so job well done to the training team. I also learned that this hotel was also only recently acquired by Doubletree which may explain why it isn't quite up to standard. It definitely has potential and with good staff that will hopefully mean I have another option in Manchester once some basic upgrades have been carried out. I will watch the internet to see what happens.
reviews.title: Hotel with potential

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: The Double Tree Hotel is centrally located and is very accessible from Manchester Piccadilly railway station. The hotel has nice clean modern rooms, free WiFi and is not too busy most of the time. It also benefits from a good restaurant and bar.
reviews.title: Nicely located business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Comfortable hotel for a week away from home. Rooms are of a good size and kept well presented. The hotel has a small gym with a reasonable selection of equipment. There are 2 restaurants to choose from - there is the bar area and the main dining room serving a selection of options - room service is also available.
reviews.title: Convenient and Comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Breakfast needs to be timed well and if all inclusive, the selection of breakfast is great.
reviews.title: Good Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: Took approximately 2 minutes from train station to hotel.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled solo
reviews.text: Im ashamed to say that I ALWAYS find something to complain about wherever I go, but I couldn't fault this hotel. Staff were extremely welcoming accommodating and helpful. I asked for a quiet room and thats exactly what I was given, not an easy task when you turn up and book early evening on a Saturday. The room was very modern and scrupulously clean. Nibbles, wine and even the biscuits to have with your tea were really yummy and of high quality. Lovely modern shower. Room temperature was controlled manually by using a panel by the door and there was no noisy fan or extractor. I had room service twice. A late night snack (which I ate whilst watching the Apple TV/Radio/Computer) and breakfast. The breakfast was delicious, probably the best Ive had in a hotel. Check out is midday, that extra hour is a real treat, 11am is too early in my book! I brought a large amount of musical equipment with me and the staff very kindly let me leave it all in the hotel for the day, after I checked out, so I could do some shopping. Very impressed overall, terrific value too. I am looking forward to my next trip, when I shall give the restaurant a go.
reviews.title: Fab Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall we were pleased with the hotel, would have liked a bath instead of just a shower cubicle. Next to the gay village and not far from the nightlife.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff friendly and helpful
reviews.title: A great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the city inn on 19-21 February, I booked it on the recommendations on Tripadvisor and it certainly lived up to all expectations, great location right accross from picadilly train station we had no problem finding it and idea walking distance from the city centre for the weary shopper on saturday. we had breakfast both mornings which was really good and with no delays. we were so tired on saturday from shopping that we ate in the hotel restaurant that night and it was excellent and very reasonably priced, I would have no hesitation to recommend it to anyone thinking of travelling to Manchester
reviews.title: great as ever - and best ever starter!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here over Valentine's weekend. 3rd visit for me but first for my husband. Fab room, great bed, lovely big shower. It was very busy and we had to wait both mornings for breakfast. However, there is juice, coffee & pastries to wait with or you can return to your room and they will ring you when your table is free. Not a worry.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights and was very impressed. Was a slight queue at check in, but more staff quickly arrived, and apologised for any delay. Welcome cookie was a nice touch! Room was very nice, spotlessly clean and bright thanks to the large windows. Loved the mac tv, even although I kept on losing the white mac remote in the white bed!!! Other nice touches included bottled water, and a nail file in the bathroom! Breakfast was good but the best bit about this hotel is definitely the staff. They were friendly, attentive, helpful and knowledgeable. The left luggage facility was much appreciated as well. Would highly recommend this hotel!
reviews.title: Top class location, service and staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, I have to say the staff were excellent at this hotel. This was my first time in Manchester and I found everyone we encountered to be polite and very helpful. This does strike me as a good solid business hotel but it's perfect for a weekend city break as location wise you are right beside the train station and all the retail shops of Piccadilly. If you like to walk, a 30 minute dander will take you to the area of Deansgate which has lovely cafes, street markets and a higher class of retail shops (Harvey Nichols, Selfridges, Hugo Boss, Armani etc) to enjoy.
reviews.title: Very good location, great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Back to the hotel, our package deal included breakfast which again was really good. Selection of fruits, pastries, breads, cereals and then the full works for a fry. They also had a "egg" menu which you could order your own choice of omelette, eggs benedict, salmon with scrambled egg etc Lots of lovely juices, jams and yoghurts again just added to a great start to each day of our weekend break.
reviews.title: Location great, cool hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: The room wasn't overly big, but we literally spent very little time in the room so it was perfectly adequate for our needs. The pillows were soft, the mattress was good as well. All the bathroom products were Crabtree and Evelyn and simply smelt delicious. We had a fridge in the room (always very helpful when away for a few days), a safe, hairdryer and a decent sized wardrobe and drawers for storage.
reviews.title: Comfort, service and class!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My husband used the gym each day and again he thought it was perfectly adequate and had most of the equipment he regularly uses at home.
reviews.title: Disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This was my first stay in a Doubletree, and I would definitely choose them again. Modern, stylish hotel, with lovely spacious glass-fronted reception area, the choice of a couple of bars, and a decent restaurant. I can only comment on the executive rooms - I found the room to be clean, modern and well-equipped. It was average size for a city centre hotel, i.e. not huge, but no complaints from me staying on my own.
reviews.title: Modern hotel with great customer service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had a fruit platter to welcome me to my room, plus a free mini-bar with half bottle of wine, couple of beers, cokes, OJ, chocolate and crisps, so along with the delicious cookie on check-in, I had no complaints on the refreshment front!
reviews.title: No complaints, would stay again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Parking is in a private underground car-park in a building next to the hotel. Ask for the concierge to validate your ticket when leaving the hotel and you get a discount on the parking fee.
reviews.title: GOOD STOP OVER IN MANCHESTER

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Staff were all very friendly and helpful, so overall I would choose this hotel and this chain again and recommend to others.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for one night as we were visiting Manchester for a concert and had stayed in the hotel a few years ago when it was the City Inn.
reviews.title: Convenient location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel was over priced for Manchester. Room was quite small. I much prefer City inn in London. This is modern hotel, but room was quite small and bed was too soft and cheapy.Not big window and dark. I was uncomfortable. Many things in my room was out of order......If you are on business, the hotel is located in front of the station, so it can be good. But not when you are not business. Breakfast was average.
reviews.title: Not good at all for non-business purpose

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel is almost brand new, excellent room with apple entertainment centre, aircon. We were on the 7th floor overlooking the main road near piccadilly station with an enormous digital billboard outside. This was flashing away all night but had a good night's sleep nontheless. The restaurant was one of the best I've encountered but with arty farty big plates with small portions. Very good food though.
reviews.title: Almost the best hotel I've stayed in.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A lovely modern hotel in the Piccadilly area of Manchester. Right near Piccadilly train station.
reviews.title: Modern hotel in a great location in the centre of Manchester.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Check in was quick, staff were polite and helpful.
reviews.title: Brilliant, stylish, friendly, central, great breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A big, comfortable room with great appliances.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

aka: Doubletree By Hilton Manchester Piccadilly Hotel
description: DoubleTree by Hilton Manchester Piccadilly occupies a landmark site on the new Piccadilly Place development. The hotel reflects the vibrancy of the city, and is located close to major national rail connections. Relax in the sophisticated surroundings of our restaurant or our alluring Piccadilly Lounge and vibrant Blue Bar, then rest in hotel rooms styled with absolute consideration for your comfort. All with excellent facilities for leisure or business guests including iMac computers and complimentary wi-fi in all rooms.
